title: About
text:
I am a PhD student in cognitive science/machine learning, researching representations of deep learning models, mechanisms of learning, and how to reduce these to interpretable forms. I work in the Institute for Human-Centered AI located at Helmholtz AI, Munich, Germany.
I like teaching myself and others about various technical topics. For the same reason, I have been wanting to start a blog for some time, which is why I made this website. I am also a certified instructor with the Software Carpentry and have taught workshops on different computational topics.

title: Why do I have a blog?
text: This is going to be a short one.

title: Why do I have a blog?
text:
Why am I doing this?
Iâ€™m writing this blog post for three reasons really:

To test whether all the website setup is working as intended.
To justify the existence of this website.
To finally commit to writing a blog1.

Iâ€™ve been meaning to start writing a blog for a while now. Partially because I realised that some of the most interesting, useful, and genuine content Iâ€™ve consumed online has been in the form of blog posts. Partially because I believe itâ€™s good for anyone to have a writing space that is persistent but not too intimidating2. And partially because I want to have more of a voice and get better at writing.

title: Why do I have a blog?
text:
What will I write about?
I have a few ideas about some technical tutorials, living in Germany, and maybe some more informal writings of my research. Iâ€™m curious to see what the composition will look like.
